channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: An extensive breakup of the road surface due to a failed repair., 19th January
item.description:
Underneath the railway bridge. It is highly dangerous to cyclists as itâ€™s below the bridge and too dark to see the problem until too late. It is getting worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside no 6 Tamar road., 19th January
item.description:
Outside no 6 Tamar road. Currently just over the size of a dinner plate and getting bigger and deeper by the day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Tamar Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Failing road repairs, 19th January
item.description:
On the left side of the road just past the turn to Pittville Circus Rd heading towards the A40 junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 157, Hewlett Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drainage on Cyclepath, 19th January
item.description:
There is constant drainage problems on the cyclepath. I have reported several times - the drains need to be cleared regularly as it leads to standing water. Last week the 'floating bus stop' was indeed that - surrounded by water.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 130, Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same
